The tech giant said its Apple Watch will automatically detect when wearers are washing their hands by monitoring hand movements and listening for the sounds of soap and water. It will count down from 20 seconds with a “keep washing” message, and alert owners if they have stopped before the timer expires. The Apple Watch, which costs £200 and up, will also alert users when they have returned to their home after time outdoors, reminding them to wash their hands, and show users statistics on how regularly they have washed, similar to logs of owners’ workouts.</p></div></div></div></li><li class="js-stream-content" data-reactid="54"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="55"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="56"><div class="Fl(start) Pos(r) Mt(2px) W(30%) Maw(255px)" data-reactid="57"><div class="H(0) Ov(h) Bdrs(2px)" style="padding-bottom:56%;" data-reactid="58"><img srcset="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/gZVlSe59Wv2kX1mimhzNHQ--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/snappa_tech_788/b5b4e9d00803a9409cebdc98a847ac0b.cf.jpg 1x,https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/rHj3BkuNY.PJC3TFRhicDg--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/snappa_tech_788/b5b4e9d00803a9409cebdc98a847ac0b.cf.jpg 2x" class=" W(100%) Trsdu(0s)! data-reactid="80"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="81"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="82"><div class="Fl(start) Pos(r) Mt(2px) W(30%) Maw(255px)" data-reactid="83"><div class="H(0) Ov(h) Bdrs(2px)" style="padding-bottom:56%;" data-reactid="84"><img srcset="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/iQGMx4bI1uOcQleQluZ2Yg--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/234b1403ccadad2e9b6863561c95f614.cf.jpg 1x,https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/wyzaKaMbKKc22CR3H_Bfiw--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/234b1403ccadad2e9b6863561c95f614.cf.jpg 2x" class=" W(100%) Trsdu(0s)! Bdrs(2px)" alt="Apple to make its own chips for Mac computers in &#x27;historic&#x27; shift" src="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/iQGMx4bI1uOcQleQluZ2Yg--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/234b1403ccadad2e9b6863561c95f614.cf.jpg" data-reactid="85"/></div></div><div class="Ov(h) Pstart(25px)" data-reactid="86"><div class="C(#959595) Fz(11px) D(ib) Mb(6px)" data-reactid="87">The Telegraph</div><h3 class="Mb(5px)" data-reactid="88"><a href="/news/apple-own-chips-mac-computers-193121947.html" class="Fw(b) Fz(18px) Lh(23px) LineClamp(2,46px) Fz(17px)--sm1024 Lh(19px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 mega-item-header-link Td(n) C(#0078ff):h C(#000) LineClamp(2,46px) LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 not-isInStreamVideoEnabled" data-reactid="89"><u class="StretchedBox" data-reactid="90"></u><!-- react-text: 91 -->Apple to make its own chips for Mac computers in &#x27;historic&#x27; shift<!-- /react-text --></a></h3><p class="Fz(14px) Lh(19px) Fz(13px)--sm1024 Lh(17px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px) LineClamp(2,34px)--sm1024 M(0)" data-reactid="92">Apple has announced plans to make its own microchips for Mac computers, a long-rumoured shift that tightens the tech giant’s control of its own products and ends a 15-year-relationship with Intel. Tim Cook, Apple’s chief executive, called the announcement a “historic day for the Mac”, saying it would start selling computers with custom chips later this year. The new chips will be designed by Apple, but rely on processor architecture developed by Cambridge-based Arm, whose designs are already used in Apple’s iPhones and iPads. The change will allow software developed for Apple’s smartphones and tablets to run seamlessly on its computers, tying the company’s products together, as well as boosting battery life on its MacBook laptops. Apple has invested huge sums in developing its own chips in recent years, making its smartphones the most powerful on the market and putting them on a par with many PCs. Applying a similar process to its Mac desktops and laptops is likely to significantly improve performance, reducing loading times and making its computers capable of demanding processes like video editing and gaming, in addition to extending batteries.</p></div></div></div></li><li class="js-stream-content" data-reactid="93"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="94"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="95"><div class="Fl(start) Pos(r) Mt(2px) W(30%) Maw(255px)" data-reactid="96"><div class="H(0) Ov(h) Bdrs(2px)" style="padding-bottom:56%;" data-reactid="97"><img srcset="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/coyIXSkQzNcWqmLwktgXnQ--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/theguardian_763/94bd8c25e23fed514b18abf66b127708.cf.jpg 1x,https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/pNvRtBxN_5Rt4.boy5Y5uQ--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/theguardian_763/94bd8c25e23fed514b18abf66b127708.cf.jpg 2x" class=" W(100%) Trsdu(0s)! With Brexit looming, the last thing the City wants is a regulator with Treasury sympathies</p></div></div></div></li><li class="js-stream-content" data-reactid="106"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="107"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="108"><div class="Ov(h) Pend(14%) Pend(0)--sm1024" data-reactid="109"><div class="C(#959595) Fz(11px) D(ib) Mb(6px)" data-reactid="110">Reuters</div><h3 class="Mb(5px)" data-reactid="111"><a href="/news/hyundai-lg-chem-draw-contest-185003950.html" class="Fw(b) Fz(18px) Lh(23px) LineClamp(2,46px) Fz(17px)--sm1024 Lh(19px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 mega-item-header-link Td(n) C(#0078ff):h C(#000) LineClamp(2,46px) LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 not-isInStreamVideoEnabled" data-reactid="112"><u class="StretchedBox" data-reactid="113"></u><!-- react-text: 114 -->Hyundai, LG Chem draw contest to invest in EV and battery startups<!-- /react-text --></a></h3><p class="Fz(14px) Lh(19px) Fz(13px)--sm1024 Lh(17px)--sm1024 LineClamp(3,57px) LineClamp(3,51px)--sm1024 M(0)" data-reactid="115">The companies said they aim to select startups with technological capabilities to help the development of future non-polluting cars through the competition, called &#x27;EV and Battery Challenge&#x27;. In a High Court hearing due to last four days, the Venezuelan central bank (BCV), controlled by Maduro&#x27;s government, is seeking an order to force the Bank of England to release the bullion that, like many countries, it stores there for safe keeping.  Lawyers representing the BCV say selling the gold, which amounts to around 15% of Venezuela&#x27;s foreign currency reserves, would fund the response to the coronavirus and bolster a health system gutted by six years of economic crisis.</p></div></div></div></li><li class="js-stream-content" data-reactid="194"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="195"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="196"><div class="Fl(start) Pos(r) Mt(2px) W(30%) Maw(255px)" data-reactid="197"><div class="H(0) Ov(h) Bdrs(2px)" style="padding-bottom:56%;" data-reactid="198"><img srcset="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/WKfjDFsJi0EDkZyeMPHXog--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/the_independent_577/73d8aebb6e8eb62fbd58bdb39ea760cc.cf.jpg 1x,https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/Vqpog89umLwA3wA_0UBejg--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/the_independent_577/73d8aebb6e8eb62fbd58bdb39ea760cc.cf.jpg 2x" class=" W(100%) Trsdu(0s)! feature, which uses filters and other technology to allow the sound to feel like it is coming from around the person despite using only two headphones, Apple said.</p></div></div></div></li><li class="js-stream-content" data-reactid="220"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="221"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="222"><div class="Fl(start) Pos(r) Mt(2px) W(30%) Maw(255px)" data-reactid="223"><div class="H(0) Ov(h) Bdrs(2px)" style="padding-bottom:56%;" data-reactid="224"><img srcset="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/63Iz180a_IRmFtmaRHhF2g--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/theguardian_763/390bd72599a5c00f97594448c2227af3.cf.jpg 1x,https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/JmDm1ThdrTnx4iJQr4osiA--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/theguardian_763/390bd72599a5c00f97594448c2227af3.cf.jpg 2x" class=" W(100%) Trsdu(0s)! class="Fl(start) Pos(r) Mt(2px) W(30%) Maw(255px)" data-reactid="236"><div class="H(0) Ov(h) Bdrs(2px)" style="padding-bottom:56%;" data-reactid="237"><img srcset="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/fB_BMujOlnNxkkVz.4xnwQ--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/the_independent_577/06e39d815a7c26ca0b9ea1e86f7a95c3.cf.jpg 2x" class=" W(100%) Trsdu(0s)! Bdrs(2px)" alt="Apple event - as it happened: All the announcements from WWDC 2020, including iPhone, Mac and Watch updates" src="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/fB_BMujOlnNxkkVz.4xnwQ--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/the_independent_577/06e39d815a7c26ca0b9ea1e86f7a95c3.cf.jpg" data-reactid="238"/></div></div><div class="Ov(h) Pstart(25px)" data-reactid="239"><div class="C(#959595) Fz(11px) D(ib) Mb(6px)" data-reactid="240">The Independent</div><h3 class="Mb(5px)" data-reactid="241"><a href="/news/apple-event-live-latest-wwdc-065700007.html" class="Fw(b) Fz(18px) Lh(23px) LineClamp(2,46px) Fz(17px)--sm1024 Lh(19px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 mega-item-header-link Td(n) C(#0078ff):h C(#000) LineClamp(2,46px) LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 not-isInStreamVideoEnabled" data-reactid="242"><u class="StretchedBox" data-reactid="243"></u><!-- react-text: 244 -->Apple event - as it happened: All the announcements from WWDC 2020, including iPhone, Mac and Watch updates<!-- /react-text --></a></h3><p class="Fz(14px) Lh(19px) Fz(13px)--sm1024 Lh(17px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px) LineClamp(2,34px)--sm1024 M(0)" data-reactid="245">Apple held its WWDC event on Monday, revealing updates for every one of its platforms.As well as new versions of the operating systems for its iPhone, iPad, Macs, Apple Watch and TVs, the company also revealed major new changes including the introduction of entirely new chips for its Macs.</p></div></div></div></li><li class="js-stream-content" data-reactid="246"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="247"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="248"><div class="Fl(start) Pos(r) Mt(2px) W(30%) Maw(255px)" data-reactid="249"><div class="H(0) Ov(h) Bdrs(2px)" style="padding-bottom:56%;" data-reactid="250"><img srcset="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/RsdcqEvQfmo5ezN2Q0j9Pg--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/2774140462e20799193d8ffe44f56b31.cf.jpg 1x,https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/52.DIzg0DRevRYsMePnyAQ--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/2774140462e20799193d8ffe44f56b31.cf.jpg 2x" class=" W(100%) Trsdu(0s)! Bdrs(2px)" alt="Apple will let you unlock your car with your iPhone" src="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/RsdcqEvQfmo5ezN2Q0j9Pg--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/2774140462e20799193d8ffe44f56b31.cf.jpg" data-reactid="251"/></div></div><div class="Ov(h) Pstart(25px)" data-reactid="252"><div class="C(#959595) Fz(11px) D(ib) Mb(6px)" data-reactid="253">The Telegraph</div><h3 class="Mb(5px)" data-reactid="254"><a href="/news/apple-let-unlock-car-iphone-173031902.html" class="Fw(b) Fz(18px) Lh(23px) LineClamp(2,46px) Fz(17px)--sm1024 Lh(19px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 mega-item-header-link Td(n) C(#0078ff):h C(#000) LineClamp(2,46px) LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 not-isInStreamVideoEnabled" data-reactid="255"><u class="StretchedBox" data-reactid="256"></u><!-- react-text: 257 -->Apple will let you unlock your car with your iPhone<!-- /react-text --></a></h3><p class="Fz(14px) Lh(19px) Fz(13px)--sm1024 Lh(17px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px) LineClamp(2,34px)--sm1024 M(0)" data-reactid="258">Apple is to let customers unlock their cars using their mobile phones, with a new feature which lets you text your car key to a friend. Officially announcing the long-rumoured feature on Monday, the company said CarKey works by pairing an iPhone or Apple Watch with a car that supports the software. For extra security a user can then be asked to confirm their identity with Face ID or Touch ID, or this can be disabled. The feature also allows iPhone owners to share their car key with someone else using iMessage, Apple&#x27;s native text messaging system. At Apple&#x27;s Wordwide Developers&#x27; Conference, which was held remotely this year due to the Covid-19 pandemic, Apple&#x27;s head of software engineering Craig Federighi said the company was &quot;transforming your relationship with your car by rethinking car keys&quot;. The feature does not require a separate app and will also let you keep multiple keys in one place. It also works for up to five hours after a phone has run out of battery. Demonstrating the feature, Emily Schubert, Apple&#x27;s senior manager of car experience engineering, said: &quot;This means one less thing you have to keep in your pocket. Digital keys have security benefits. They live in the secure element of your iPhone.&quot; The feature also has the option to restrict the time a family member or friend has access to the car. It will appear in the current operating system, iOS 13, but currently only works with the newest BMW 5 Series car, which comes out next month. Apple said other cars would be included next year. Electric car company Tesla already allows owners to unlock their cars using a mobile phone, and other car manufacturers including Lincoln and Hyundai have also developed apps which work as car keys.</p></div></div></div></li><li class="js-stream-content" data-reactid="259"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="260"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="261"><div class="Fl(start) Pos(r) Mt(2px) W(30%) Maw(255px)" data-reactid="262"><div class="H(0) Ov(h) Bdrs(2px)" style="padding-bottom:56%;" data-reactid="263"><img srcset="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/uXA1Vygx1EuTfq.wRBOaWw--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/theguardian_763/5475b38f31ee8a80ebab4a010c4e8609.cf.jpg 1x,https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/OreRXR0p60muCC_Skd8xQw--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/theguardian_763/5475b38f31ee8a80ebab4a010c4e8609.cf.jpg 2x" class=" W(100%) Trsdu(0s)! Bdrs(2px)" alt="How will we know when Australia&#x27;s economy is back to normal?" src="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/uXA1Vygx1EuTfq.wRBOaWw--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/theguardian_763/5475b38f31ee8a80ebab4a010c4e8609.cf.jpg" data-reactid="264"/></div></div><div class="Ov(h) Pstart(25px)" data-reactid="265"><div class="C(#959595) Fz(11px) D(ib) Mb(6px)" data-reactid="266">The Guardian</div><h3 class="Mb(5px)" data-reactid="267"><a href="/news/know-australias-economy-back-normal-173024878.html" class="Fw(b) Fz(18px) Lh(23px) LineClamp(2,46px) Fz(17px)--sm1024 Lh(19px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 mega-item-header-link Td(n) C(#0078ff):h C(#000) LineClamp(2,46px) LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 not-isInStreamVideoEnabled" data-reactid="268"><u class="StretchedBox" data-reactid="269"></u><!-- react-text: 270 -->How will we know when Australia&#x27;s economy is back to normal?<!-- /react-text --></a></h3><p class="Fz(14px) Lh(19px) Fz(13px)--sm1024 Lh(17px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px) LineClamp(2,34px)--sm1024 M(0)" data-reactid="271">How will we know when Australia&#x27;s economy is back to normal?. We could focus on hours worked per capita – but even that won’t tell us what the job market will really be like</p></div></div></div></li><li class="js-stream-content" data-reactid="272"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="273"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="274"><div class="Fl(start) Pos(r) Mt(2px) W(30%) Maw(255px)" data-reactid="275"><div class="H(0) Ov(h) Bdrs(2px)" style="padding-bottom:56%;" data-reactid="276"><img srcset="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/utyou.2nYhHPJLPZIsHlhw--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/reuters.com/a2909655247599428c65dedb64131c33.cf.jpg 1x,https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/9reFF1_kyuf_nrj4TLqJDQ--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/reuters.com/a2909655247599428c65dedb64131c33.cf.jpg 2x" class=" W(100%) Trsdu(0s)! Bdrs(2px)" alt="Dior revives fashion shows - but with no front row" src="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/utyou.2nYhHPJLPZIsHlhw--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/reuters.com/a2909655247599428c65dedb64131c33.cf.jpg" data-reactid="277"/></div></div><div class="Ov(h) Pstart(25px)" data-reactid="278"><div class="C(#959595) Fz(11px) D(ib) Mb(6px)" data-reactid="279">Reuters</div><h3 class="Mb(5px)" data-reactid="280"><a href="/news/dior-revives-fashion-shows-no-172136607.html" class="Fw(b) Fz(18px) Lh(23px) LineClamp(2,46px) Fz(17px)--sm1024 Lh(19px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 mega-item-header-link Td(n) C(#0078ff):h C(#000) LineClamp(2,46px) LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 not-isInStreamVideoEnabled" data-reactid="281"><u class="StretchedBox" data-reactid="282"></u><!-- react-text: 283 -->Dior revives fashion shows - but with no front row<!-- /react-text --></a></h3><p class="Fz(14px) Lh(19px) Fz(13px)--sm1024 Lh(17px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px) LineClamp(2,34px)--sm1024 M(0)" data-reactid="284">French luxury label Christian Dior said on Monday it would press ahead with a calendar of fashion shows for this year starting in July with an Italian catwalk display - but without the celebrated front-row audience of A-listers.  Dior, one of the LVMH &lt;LVMH.PA&gt; conglomerate&#x27;s biggest labels, said it was maintaining its calendar of industry fashion weeks that brings buyers and bloggers to Paris, and would produce other collections in between.  It will premiere a mid-season &quot;cruise&quot; range in the Italian city of Lecce on July 22 with a streamed live show, Chief Executive Pietro Beccari said, after a presentation planned for May was postponed.</p></div></div></div></li><li class="js-stream-content" data-reactid="285"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="286"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="287"><div class="Fl(start) Pos(r) Mt(2px) W(30%) Maw(255px)" data-reactid="288"><div class="H(0) Ov(h) Bdrs(2px)" style="padding-bottom:56%;" data-reactid="289"><img srcset="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/MKMHVXqe6nD4IJ6HAGEtNA--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/theguardian_763/e6dec2bde49703240c26b12e2702b861.cf.jpg 1x,https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/oDclrzvWXZXqS2Q4z0sDQw--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/theguardian_763/e6dec2bde49703240c26b12e2702b861.cf.jpg 2x" class=" W(100%) Trsdu(0s)! Bdrs(2px)" alt="Concerns raised  over proposed registration for England&#x27;s drinkers and diners" src="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/MKMHVXqe6nD4IJ6HAGEtNA--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/theguardian_763/e6dec2bde49703240c26b12e2702b861.cf.jpg" data-reactid="290"/></div></div><div class="Ov(h) Pstart(25px)" data-reactid="291"><div class="C(#959595) Fz(11px) D(ib) Mb(6px)" data-reactid="292">The Guardian</div><h3 class="Mb(5px)" data-reactid="293"><a href="/news/concerns-raised-over-proposed-registration-171357751.html" class="Fw(b) Fz(18px) Lh(23px) LineClamp(2,46px) Fz(17px)--sm1024 Lh(19px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 mega-item-header-link Td(n) C(#0078ff):h C(#000) LineClamp(2,46px) LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 not-isInStreamVideoEnabled" data-reactid="294"><u class="StretchedBox" data-reactid="295"></u><!-- react-text: 296 -->Concerns raised  over proposed registration for England&#x27;s drinkers and diners<!-- /react-text --></a></h3><p class="Fz(14px) Lh(19px) Fz(13px)--sm1024 Lh(17px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px) LineClamp(2,34px)--sm1024 M(0)" data-reactid="297">Concerns raised over proposed registration for England&#x27;s drinkers and diners. Trade bodies say thought needs to be given to ways of encouraging people to provide details</p></div></div></div></li><li class="js-stream-content" data-reactid="298"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="299"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="300"><div class="Fl(start) Pos(r) Mt(2px) W(30%) Maw(255px)" data-reactid="301"><div class="H(0) Ov(h) Bdrs(2px)" style="padding-bottom:56%;" data-reactid="302"><img srcset="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/Jn1utN0l9SLJwD0rqdY4Fw--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/a4e00f8d0d77289fbee05e98d93ea728.cf.jpg 1x,https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/RMcIizx7chA6jUDGlzGvLQ--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/a4e00f8d0d77289fbee05e98d93ea728.cf.jpg 2x" class=" W(100%) Trsdu(0s)! Bdrs(2px)" alt="Bailey: Government &#x27;would have struggled to fund itself&#x27; without £200bn rescue" src="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/Jn1utN0l9SLJwD0rqdY4Fw--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/a4e00f8d0d77289fbee05e98d93ea728.cf.jpg" data-reactid="303"/></div></div><div class="Ov(h) Pstart(25px)" data-reactid="304"><div class="C(#959595) Fz(11px) D(ib) Mb(6px)" data-reactid="305">The Telegraph</div><h3 class="Mb(5px)" data-reactid="306"><a href="/news/bailey-government-struggled-fund-itself-171132489.html" class="Fw(b) Fz(18px) Lh(23px) LineClamp(2,46px) Fz(17px)--sm1024 Lh(19px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 mega-item-header-link Td(n) C(#0078ff):h C(#000) LineClamp(2,46px) LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 not-isInStreamVideoEnabled" data-reactid="307"><u class="StretchedBox" data-reactid="308"></u><!-- react-text: 309 -->Bailey: Government &#x27;would have struggled to fund itself&#x27; without £200bn rescue<!-- /react-text --></a></h3><p class="Fz(14px) Lh(19px) Fz(13px)--sm1024 Lh(17px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px) LineClamp(2,34px)--sm1024 M(0)" data-reactid="310">The Bank of England was forced to save the Government from potential financial collapse as markets seized up at the height of the coronavirus crisis, Governor Andrew Bailey has said. In his most explicit comments yet on the country&#x27;s precarious position in mid-March, Mr Bailey said &quot;serious disorder&quot; broke out after panicking investors sold UK government bonds in a desperate hunt for cash. It left Britain at risk of failing to auction off the gilts needed to fund crucial spending - and Threadneedle Street had to pump £200bn into the markets to restore a semblance of order. In comments to Sky News, Mr Bailey said that without the emergency move &quot;the prospects would have been very bad. It would have been very serious”. He added: &quot;I think we would have a situation where in the worst element, the Government would have struggled to fund itself in the short run.&quot; The intervention to prop up the gilt market was expanded last week by the Bank&#x27;s Monetary Policy Committee with a further £100bn although Mr Bailey warned explicitly on Monday that this support for financial markets will not last forever. Any wind-down will pile further pressure on the Treasury’s funding costs as Chancellor Rishi Sunak faces a deficit of at least £300bn this year. Mr Sunak is said to be considering a VAT cut followed by tax rises over the longer term, but economists have warned the former could fail to have any real positive effect while the latter would be a disaster that chokes off recovery. Former Chancellor Lord Darling proposed a VAT cut to boost consumption following his own similar move in the wake of the 2008 crash. But Julian Jessop, a fellow at the Institute of Economic Affairs, said: “It’s hard to imagine a worse combination than a temporary VAT cut to stimulate spending that is likely to happen anyway, offset by the threat of future tax rises that would cast a long shadow over the economic recovery. “The demand problem isn’t a lack of willingness to spend, it’s the ability to spend. It makes far more sense just to open the shops, pubs and restaurants and cut employer insurance contributions. People would be far more likely to spend if they knew their jobs were safe.” Richard Hyman, an independent retail analyst, warned that online retailers such as Amazon – rather than bricks-and-mortar shops – would be the main beneficiaries of cutting VAT. He said: “Retail needs whatever help it can get but a VAT cut won’t necessarily make a massive difference in the short term to most physical retailers.”</p></div></div></div></li><li class="js-stream-content" data-reactid="311"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="312"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="313"><div class="Fl(start) Pos(r) Mt(2px) W(30%) Maw(255px)" data-reactid="314"><div class="H(0) Ov(h) Bdrs(2px)" style="padding-bottom:56%;" data-reactid="315"><img srcset="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/WKfjDFsJi0EDkZyeMPHXog--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/the_independent_577/73d8aebb6e8eb62fbd58bdb39ea760cc.cf.jpg 1x,https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/Vqpog89umLwA3wA_0UBejg--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/the_independent_577/73d8aebb6e8eb62fbd58bdb39ea760cc.cf.jpg 2x" class=" W(100%) Trsdu(0s)! Bdrs(2px)" alt="iOS 14: Apple unveils major new update for iPhone software" src="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/WKfjDFsJi0EDkZyeMPHXog--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/the_independent_577/73d8aebb6e8eb62fbd58bdb39ea760cc.cf.jpg" data-reactid="316"/></div></div><div class="Ov(h) Pstart(25px)" data-reactid="317"><div class="C(#959595) Fz(11px) D(ib) Mb(6px)" data-reactid="318">The Independent</div><h3 class="Mb(5px)" data-reactid="319"><a href="/news/ios-14-apple-unveils-major-170700949.html" class="Fw(b) Fz(18px) Lh(23px) LineClamp(2,46px) Fz(17px)--sm1024 Lh(19px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 mega-item-header-link Td(n) C(#0078ff):h C(#000) LineClamp(2,46px) LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 not-isInStreamVideoEnabled" data-reactid="320"><u class="StretchedBox" data-reactid="321"></u><!-- react-text: 322 -->iOS 14: Apple unveils major new update for iPhone software<!-- /react-text --></a></h3><p class="Fz(14px) Lh(19px) Fz(13px)--sm1024 Lh(17px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px) LineClamp(2,34px)--sm1024 M(0)" data-reactid="323">Apple has unveiled iOS 14, its new operating system for the iPhone.The update includes fundamental changes to the home screen that shows whenever a user opens up their phone. Instead of seeing their apps spread across a variety of screens, they will instead see an &quot;App Library&quot;, which is intended to stop people having to search through their various pages.</p></div></div></div></li><li class="js-stream-content" data-reactid="324"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="325"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="326"><div class="Fl(start) Pos(r) Mt(2px) W(30%) Maw(255px)" data-reactid="327"><div class="H(0) Ov(h) Bdrs(2px)" style="padding-bottom:56%;" data-reactid="328"><img srcset="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/hgzADauPvJ2eSwSNYMqFtw--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/c05ddc04c7a4d164c046b625848e5ccb.cf.jpg 1x,https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/tgBQTrzY111KoPWRnm9Y9g--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/c05ddc04c7a4d164c046b625848e5ccb.cf.jpg 2x" class=" W(100%) Trsdu(0s)! Bdrs(2px)" alt="Apple iOS 14: The best new features coming to the iPhone" src="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/hgzADauPvJ2eSwSNYMqFtw--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/c05ddc04c7a4d164c046b625848e5ccb.cf.jpg" data-reactid="329"/></div></div><div class="Ov(h) Pstart(25px)" data-reactid="330"><div class="C(#959595) Fz(11px) D(ib) Mb(6px)" data-reactid="331">The Telegraph</div><h3 class="Mb(5px)" data-reactid="332"><a href="/news/apple-ios-14-best-features-170213522.html" class="Fw(b) Fz(18px) Lh(23px) LineClamp(2,46px) Fz(17px)--sm1024 Lh(19px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 mega-item-header-link Td(n) C(#0078ff):h C(#000) LineClamp(2,46px) LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 not-isInStreamVideoEnabled" data-reactid="333"><u class="StretchedBox" data-reactid="334"></u><!-- react-text: 335 -->Apple iOS 14: The best new features coming to the iPhone<!-- /react-text --></a></h3><p class="Fz(14px) Lh(19px) Fz(13px)--sm1024 Lh(17px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px) LineClamp(2,34px)--sm1024 M(0)" data-reactid="336">Apple has announced a new version of its iOS operating system, with a host of new features including home screen widgets and updates to the messages feature. At the company&#x27;s Worldwide Developers&#x27; Conference, which this year was held remotely due to Covid-19, executives announced a series of updates to the software, as well as changes to the iPad and Apple Watch operating systems. iOS 14 will be introduce in autumn for iPhone 6s and later. Here are the highlights. Widgets A long-desired feature, Apple&#x27;s new widgets will let users pin useful tools - interactive mini previews of apps - on their home screen. This could include a shortcut to a TV show, weather updates, a daily meeting schedule or sport results. The new iOS also has a feature called &quot;Smart Stack&quot;, which can be placed on the homepage and changes depending on its prediction of what the user needs in a particular location, time of day or activity.</p></div></div></div></li><li class="js-stream-content" data-reactid="337"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="338"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="339"><div class="Ov(h) Pend(14%) Pend(0)--sm1024" data-reactid="340"><div class="C(#959595) Fz(11px) D(ib) Mb(6px)" data-reactid="341">Reuters</div><h3 class="Mb(5px)" data-reactid="342"><a href="/news/germanys-pharma-firm-boehringer-offload-165350232.html" class="Fw(b) Fz(18px) Lh(23px) LineClamp(2,46px) Fz(17px)--sm1024 Lh(19px)--sm1024 LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 mega-item-header-link Td(n) C(#0078ff):h C(#000) LineClamp(2,46px) LineClamp(2,38px)--sm1024 not-isInStreamVideoEnabled" data-reactid="343"><u class="StretchedBox" data-reactid="344"></u><!-- react-text: 345 -->Hikma&#x27;s major investor to exit nearly 1 bln pound stake in drugmaker<!-- /react-text --></a></h3><p class="Fz(14px) Lh(19px) Fz(13px)--sm1024 Lh(17px)--sm1024 LineClamp(3,57px) LineClamp(3,51px)--sm1024 M(0)" data-reactid="346">A bookrunner for the deal said Boehringer would sell 28 million shares, worth about 700 million pounds, while Hikma  said it would purchase the remaining shares for not more than 295 million pounds.  Germany-based private firm Boehringer currently holds 16.45%, or roughly 40 million, of Hikma&#x27;s share capital and voting rights, according to Refinitiv Eikon data, making it the drugmaker&#x27;s second-biggest shareholder after Darhold Ltd.</p></div></div></div></li><li class="js-stream-content" data-reactid="347"><div class="Py(14px) Pos(r)" data-test-locator="mega" data-reactid="348"><div class="Cf" data-reactid="349"><div class="Fl(start) Pos(r) Mt(2px) W(30%) Maw(255px)" data-reactid="350"><div class="H(0) Ov(h) Bdrs(2px)" style="padding-bottom:56%;" data-reactid="351"><img srcset="https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/Xvl5xEfuH4LjwiPmiRPLxg--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/reuters.com/b532815d8d111c67a4c9e07353f8b52c.cf.jpg 1x,https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/.IZl.S.djqrSukeET0s45A--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/reuters.com/b532815d8d111c67a4c9e07353f8b52c.cf.jpg 2x" class=" W(100%) Trsdu(0s)! Industry trade group Cruise Lines International Association (CLIA) said on Friday its ocean-going cruise line members, which include Carnival, Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd &lt;RCL.N&gt;, and Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd &lt;NCLH.N&gt;, would voluntarily extend their pause in operations from U.S. ports until Sept. 15.</p></div></div></div></li></ul></div></div></div><script>if Guardian","publisher_id":"theguardian_763","off_network":false},{"i13n":{"bpos":1,"cpos":5,"cposy":8},"summary":"Apple has announced plans to make its own microchips for Mac computers, a long-rumoured shift that tightens the tech giant’s control of its own products and ends a 15-year-relationship with Intel. Tim Cook, Apple’s chief executive, called the announcement a “historic day for the Mac”, saying it would start selling computers with custom chips later this year. The new chips will be designed by Apple, but rely on processor architecture developed by Cambridge-based Arm, whose designs are already used in Apple’s iPhones and iPads. The change will allow software developed for Apple’s smartphones and tablets to run seamlessly on its computers, tying the company’s products together, as well as boosting battery life on its MacBook laptops. Apple has invested huge sums in developing its own chips in recent years, making its smartphones the most powerful on the market and putting them on a par with many PCs. Applying a similar process to its Mac desktops and laptops is likely to significantly improve performance, reducing loading times and making its computers capable of demanding processes like video editing and gaming, in addition to extending batteries.","pubtime":1592854281000,"is_eligible":true,"url":"https:\u002F\u002Fuk.finance.yahoo.com\u002Fnews\u002Fapple-own-chips-mac-computers-193121947.html","property":"Business","categoryLabel":"Business","title":"Apple to make its own chips for Mac computers in 'historic' shift","images":{"original":{"height":1563,"width":2499,"url":"https:\u002F\u002Fs.yimg.com\u002Fuu\u002Fapi\u002Fres\u002F1.2\u002F3eFBNjI8NAIA4SpCYzfOkg--~B\u002FaD0xNTYzO3c9MjQ5OTthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--\u002Fhttps:\u002F\u002Fmedia.zenfs.com\u002Fen-GB\u002Fthe_telegraph_818\u002F234b1403ccadad2e9b6863561c95f614.cf.jpg"},"img:220x123":{"height":123,"width":220,"url":"https:\u002F\u002Fs.yimg.com\u002Fuu\u002Fapi\u002Fres\u002F1.2\u002FiQGMx4bI1uOcQleQluZ2Yg--~B\u002FZmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--\u002Fhttps:\u002F\u002Fmedia.zenfs.com\u002Fen-GB\u002Fthe_telegraph_818\u002F234b1403ccadad2e9b6863561c95f614.cf.jpg"},"img:440x246":{"height":246,"width":440,"url":"https:\u002F\u002Fs.yimg.com\u002Fuu\u002Fapi\u002Fres\u002F1.2\u002FwyzaKaMbKKc22CR3H_Bfiw--~B\u002FZmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--\u002Fhttps:\u002F\u002Fmedia.zenfs.com\u002Fen-GB\u002Fthe_telegraph_818\u002F234b1403ccadad2e9b6863561c95f614.cf.jpg"}},"type":"article","link":"\u002Fnews\u002Fapple-own-chips-mac-computers-193121947.html","id":"3cf836b8-cd96-3fa2-b579-ef0be89553c9","publisher":"The Telegraph","publisher_id":"the_telegraph_818","off_network":false},{"i13n":{"bpos":1,"cpos":6,"cposy":9},"summary":"The new face at the FCA needs to keep politicians at arms length. Independent","publisher_id":"the_independent_577","off_network":false},{"i13n":{"bpos":1,"cpos":18,"cposy":21},"summary":"Apple is to let customers unlock their cars using their mobile phones, with a new feature which lets you text your car key to a friend. Officially announcing the long-rumoured feature on Monday, the company said CarKey works by pairing an iPhone or Apple Watch with a car that supports the software. For extra security a user can then be asked to confirm their identity with Face ID or Touch ID, or this can be disabled. The feature also allows iPhone owners to share their car key with someone else using iMessage, Apple's native text messaging system. At Apple's Wordwide Developers' Conference, which was held remotely this year due to the Covid-19 pandemic, Apple's head of software engineering Craig Federighi said the company was \"transforming your relationship with your car by rethinking car keys\". The feature does not require a separate app and will also let you keep multiple keys in one place. It also works for up to five hours after a phone has run out of battery. Demonstrating the feature, Emily Schubert, Apple's senior manager of car experience engineering, said: \"This means one less thing you have to keep in your pocket. Digital keys have security benefits. They live in the secure element of your iPhone.\" The feature also has the option to restrict the time a family member or friend has access to the car. It will appear in the current operating system, iOS 13, but currently only works with the newest BMW 5 Series car, which comes out next month. Apple said other cars would be included next year. In his most explicit comments yet on the country's precarious position in mid-March, Mr Bailey said \"serious disorder\" broke out after panicking investors sold UK government bonds in a desperate hunt for cash. It left Britain at risk of failing to auction off the gilts needed to fund crucial spending - and Threadneedle Street had to pump £200bn into the markets to restore a semblance of order. In comments to Sky News, Mr Bailey said that without the emergency move \"the prospects would have been very bad. It would have been very serious”. He added: \"I think we would have a situation where in the worst element, the Government would have struggled to fund itself in the short run.\" The intervention to prop up the gilt market was expanded last week by the Bank's Monetary Policy Committee with a further £100bn although Mr Bailey warned explicitly on Monday that this support for financial markets will not last forever. Any wind-down will pile further pressure on the Treasury’s funding costs as Chancellor Rishi Sunak faces a deficit of at least £300bn this year. Mr Sunak is said to be considering a VAT cut followed by tax rises over the longer term, but economists have warned the former could fail to have any real positive effect while the latter would be a disaster that chokes off recovery. Former Chancellor Lord Darling proposed a VAT cut to boost consumption following his own similar move in the wake of the 2008 crash. But Julian Jessop, a fellow at the Institute of Economic Affairs, said: “It’s hard to imagine a worse combination than a temporary VAT cut to stimulate spending that is likely to happen anyway, offset by the threat of future tax rises that would cast a long shadow over the economic recovery. “The demand problem isn’t a lack of willingness to spend, it’s the ability to spend. It makes far more sense just to open the shops, pubs and restaurants and cut employer insurance contributions. People would be far more likely to spend if they knew their jobs were safe.” Richard Hyman, an independent retail analyst, warned that online retailers such as Amazon – rather than bricks-and-mortar shops – would be the main beneficiaries of cutting VAT. He said: “Retail needs whatever help it can get but a VAT cut won’t necessarily make a massive difference in the short term to most physical retailers.”","pubtime":1592845892000,"is_eligible":true,"url":"https:\u002F\u002Fuk.finance.yahoo.com\u002Fnews\u002Fbailey-government-struggled-fund-itself-171132489.html","property":"Business","categoryLabel":"Business","title":"Bailey: Government 'would have struggled to fund itself' without £200bn rescue","images":{"original":{"height":1563,"width":2501,"url":"https:\u002F\u002Fs.yimg.com\u002Fuu\u002Fapi\u002Fres\u002F1.2\u002FppeehHExJc69g5zWe5fsUQ--~B\u002FaD0xNTYzO3c9MjUwMTthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--\u002Fhttps:\u002F\u002Fmedia.zenfs.com\u002Fen-GB\u002Fthe_telegraph_818\u002Fa4e00f8d0d77289fbee05e98d93ea728.cf.jpg"},"img:220x123":{"height":123,"width":220,"url":"https:\u002F\u002Fs.yimg.com\u002Fuu\u002Fapi\u002Fres\u002F1.2\u002FJn1utN0l9SLJwD0rqdY4Fw--~B\u002FZmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjM7cT04MDt3PTIyMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--\u002Fhttps:\u002F\u002Fmedia.zenfs.com\u002Fen-GB\u002Fthe_telegraph_818\u002Fa4e00f8d0d77289fbee05e98d93ea728.cf.jpg"},"img:440x246":{"height":246,"width":440,"url":"https:\u002F\u002Fs.yimg.com\u002Fuu\u002Fapi\u002Fres\u002F1.2\u002FRMcIizx7chA6jUDGlzGvLQ--~B\u002FZmk9c3RyaW07aD0yNDY7cT04MDt3PTQ0MDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--\u002Fhttps:\u002F\u002Fmedia.zenfs.com\u002Fen-GB\u002Fthe_telegraph_818\u002Fa4e00f8d0d77289fbee05e98d93ea728.cf.jpg"}},"type":"article","link":"\u002Fnews\u002Fbailey-government-struggled-fund-itself-171132489.html","id":"73a72b98-554a-3248-a607-e0058a84519e","publisher":"The Telegraph","publisher_id":"the_telegraph_818","off_network":false},{"i13n":{"bpos":1,"cpos":23,"cposy":26},"summary":"Apple has unveiled iOS 14, its new operating system for the iPhone.The update includes fundamental changes to the home screen that shows whenever a user opens up their phone. This could include a shortcut to a TV show, weather updates, a daily meeting schedule or sport results. A lower score is better than a higher score, as it indicates fewer controversies. Controversies are represented as: Low, Moderate, Significant, High or Severe, or None if there is no evidence of controversy.","ESG_PORT_ESG_DEF":"The portfolio ESG score is the asset-weighted average of the normalised company ESG scores for the covered holdings in a portfolio. Higher scores are better than lower scores and, at the portfolio level, indicate that a fund has more of its assets invested in companies that score well under Sustainalytics' ESG methodology, which evaluates company preparedness, disclosure. ","ESG_PORT_SCORE":"Portfolio sustainability score","ESG_POWERED_BY":"ESG data provided by Sustainalytics, Inc.","ESG_PRODUCT_INVOLVE_DEF":"Flags a company’s involvement in products, services and business activities commonly used for screening purposes.","ESG_RATINGS_DEF":"Sustainalytics’ ESG risk ratings assess the degree to which a company’s enterprise business value is at risk driven by environmental, social and governance issues. The rating employs a two-dimensional framework that combines an assessment of a company’s exposure to industry-specific material ESG issues with an assessment of how well the company is managing those issues. The final ESG risk rating scores are a measure of unmanaged risk on an absolute scale of 0-100, with a lower score signalling less unmanaged ESG risk.","ESG_RATINGS":"Environment, social and governance (ESG) risk ratings","ESG_REL_CAT":"Relative to Morningstar category: {relation}","ESG_S":"S","ESG_SCORE_PEERS":"ESG risk score for peers","ESG_SCORE":"ESG risk score","ESG_SMALLARMS":"Small arms","ESG_SOCIALLY_RESPONSIBLE_FUND_DEF":"An indication that the fund discloses in their prospectus that they employ socially responsible or ESG principles in their investment selection processes. Morningstar categories help investors and investment professionals make meaningful comparisons between funds. The categories make it easier to build well-diversified portfolios, assess potential risk and identify top-performing funds. We place funds in a given category based on their portfolio statistics and compositions over the past three years. If the fund is new and has no portfolio history, we estimate where it will fall before giving it a more permanent category assignment. Where necessary, we may change a category assignment based on recent changes to the portfolio.","MORNINGSTAR_CATEGORY":"Morningstar category","MORNINGSTAR_STYLE_BOX_DESC":"Yahoo partners with Morningstar, a leading market research and investment data group to help investors rate and compare funds on Yahoo Finance. <div><script type="text/javascript">window._loadEvt = false; 
window._adPerfData = []; 
window._adPosMsg = []; 
window._perfMark = function _perfMark (name) {if (window.performance && window.performance.mark){try {if (window.performance.getEntriesByName("NAVIGATE_START") && window.performance.getEntriesByName("NAVIGATE_START")[0]) { name = "CL_" + name ;}window.performance.mark(name);} catch (e) {console.warn(name + ' could not be marked:',e);}};};
window._perfMeasure = function _perfMeasure (name, start, end) {if (window.performance && window.performance.measure){try {if (window.performance.getEntriesByName("NAVIGATE_START") && window.performance.getEntriesByName("NAVIGATE_START")[0]) { start = "CL_" + start ;end = "CL_" + end ;name = "CL_" + name ;}window.performance.measure(name, start, end);} catch (e) {console.warn(name + ' could not be added:',e);}};};
window._pushAdPerfMetric = function _pushAdPerfMetric(key) {if (window.performance && window.performance.now) {_adPerfData.push([key, Math.round(window.performance.now())]);}};
window._fireAdPerfBeacon = function _fireAdPerfBeacon(eventName) {try {if (window && window.rapidInstance && window.performance) {var navClickMark = window.performance.getEntriesByName('NAVIGATE_START') &&window.performance.getEntriesByName('NAVIGATE_START').pop();var navClickTime = navClickMark && navClickMark.startTime || 0;var userTime = {};window.performance.getEntries().forEach(function forEachPerfTime (item) {if (item.name.search('DARLA_') > -1) {if (item.entryType === "mark") {userTime[item.name] = Math.round(item.startTime) - navClickTime;window.performance.clearMarks(item.name);} else if (item.entryType === "measure") {userTime[item.name] = Math.round(item.duration);window.performance.clearMeasures(item.name);}}});var perfData = {perf_usertime: {utm: userTime}};
window.rapidInstance.beaconPerformanceData(perfData);}} catch (e) {console.warn('Could not send the beacon:',e);}};

window.DARLA_CONFIG.servicePath = window.location.protocol + "//fc.yahoo.com/sdarla/php/fc.php";window.DARLA_CONFIG.dm = 1;window.DARLA_CONFIG.onStartRequest = function() {window._perfMark('DARLA_REQSTART');};
window.DARLA_CONFIG.onFinishRequest = function() {window._perfMark('DARLA_REQEND');};
window.DARLA_CONFIG.onStartParse = function() {window._perfMark('DARLA_PSTART');};
window.DARLA_CONFIG.onSuccess = function(eventName) {if (eventName === 'AUTO') {return;}if (window._DarlaEvents) {window._DarlaEvents.emit("success", {eventName: eventName});}window._perfMark('DARLA_DONE_' + eventName);window._darlaSuccessEvt = eventName;if (window._loadEvt) {window._fireAdPerfBeacon(eventName);}};
window.DARLA_CONFIG.onStartPosRender = function(posItem) {var posId = posItem && posItem.pos;window._perfMark('DARLA_ADSTART_' + posId);if (window._pushAdPerfMetric) {window._pushAdPerfMetric("DARLA_ADSTART_" + posId);}};
window.DARLA_CONFIG.onFinishPosRender = function(posId, reqList, posItem) {var ltime;window._perfMark('DARLA_ADEND_' + posId);window._perfMeasure('DARLA_RENDERTIME_' + posId, 'DARLA_ADSTART_'+posId, 'DARLA_ADEND_'+posId);if(window._DarlaEvents) {window._DarlaEvents.emit("finishrender", {pos:posId, list:reqList, item:posItem});}var aboveFoldPositions = ["WPS","MAST","LDRB","SPRZ","SPL","LREC","BTN","BTN-1","BTN-2","BTN-3","BTN1","BTNA","BTNB","BTNC","BTND","FB2","FB2-1","FB2-2","FB2-3","FB2A","FB2B","FB2C","FB2D","NE4","NE4-1","NE4-2","NE4-3","NE4A","NE4B","NE4C","NE4D"];if (window._pushAdPerfMetric) {if (window.performance && window.performance.now) {ltime = window.performance.now();}window._pushAdPerfMetric("ADEND_"+posId);var adModDiv = posItem.conf.dest.replace("dest", "") + "-sizer";setTimeout(function () {if (window.performance && window.YAFT !== undefined &&window.YAFT.isInitialized() && -1 !== aboveFoldPositions.indexOf(posId)) {window.YAFT.triggerCustomTiming(adModDiv, "", ltime);}}, 300);}};
window.DARLA_CONFIG.onBeforePosMsg = function(msg, posId) {var maxWidth = 970, maxHeight = 600;var newWidth, newHeight, pos;if (window._DarlaEvents && msg === "exp-push" && posId && 0 === posId.indexOf("LREC")) {window._DarlaEvents.emit("exp-push", arguments);}if ("MAST" !== posId) {return;}if (msg === "resize-to") {newWidth = arguments[2];newHeight = arguments[3];} else if (msg === "exp-push" || msg === "exp-ovr") {pos = $sf.host.get("MAST");newWidth = pos.conf.w + arguments[6] + arguments[7];newHeight = pos.conf.h + arguments[5] + arguments[8];}if (newWidth > maxWidth || newHeight > maxHeight) {return true;}};
window.DARLA_CONFIG.onFinishParse = function(eventName, response) {try {window._perfMark('DARLA_PEND');if (eventName === "prefetch") {window._DarlaPrefetchResponse = response;}if (window._DarlaEvents) {window._DarlaEvents.emit("finishparse", {response: response,eventName: eventName});}} catch (e) {console.error(e);throw e;}if (eventName === "AUTO") {var adPositionList = response.ps();var groupAdsList = [];for (var i = 0; i < groupAdsList.length; i++) {if (adPositionList.indexOf(groupAdsList[i]) >= 0) {var adPosItem = response.item(groupAdsList[i]);if (!adPosItem.hasErr && adPosItem.size + "" !== "1x1" && (adPosItem.meta && adPosItem.meta.y && adPosItem.meta.y.size && adPosItem.meta.y.size + "" !== "1x1")) {var adNode = document.getElementById("default" + groupAdsList[i] + "-sizer");if (adNode && adNode.classList) {adNode.classList.remove("D(n)");adNode.classList.remove("D-n");}}}}}
};
window.DARLA_CONFIG.onStartPrefetchRequest = function(eventName) {window._perfMark('DARLA_PFSTART');};
window.DARLA_CONFIG.onFinishPrefetchRequest = function(eventName, status) {window._perfMark('DARLA_PFEND');try {window._DarlaEvents.emit('finishprefetch', {status: status,eventName: eventName});} catch (e) {console.error(e);throw e;}
};
window.DARLA_CONFIG.onPosMsg = function(cmd, pos, msg) {try {if (window._DarlaEvents && cmd === "cmsg") {var posmsg = {pos: pos,msg: msg};window._DarlaEvents.emit("splashmsg", posmsg);if (window._adPosMsg) {window._adPosMsg[window._adPosMsg.length] = posmsg;}}if (window._DarlaEvents && (cmd === "ui-fclose-show" || cmd === "ui-fclose-close")) {setTimeout(function _emitAdResize(){window._DarlaEvents.emit("adresize", {pos: pos})}, 0);}} catch (e) {console.error(e);throw e;}
};
(function () {var _onloadEvt = function _onloadEvtHandler() {window._loadEvt = true;if (window._darlaSuccessEvt) {window._fireAdPerfBeacon(window._darlaSuccessEvt);}};if (window.addEventListener) {window.addEventListener("load", _onloadEvt);} else if (window.attachEvent) {window.attachEvent("onload", _onloadEvt);}function _onDarlaError (type) {return function _darlaErrHandler(evName) {try {if (window._DarlaEvents) {window._DarlaEvents.emit("darlaerror" + evName);window._DarlaEvents.emit("darlaerror", {type: type,eventName: evName,error: true});}} catch (e) {console.error(e);throw e;}};};window.DARLA_CONFIG.onRequestTimeout = _onDarlaError("requestTimeout");window.DARLA_CONFIG.onRenderTimeout = _onDarlaError("renderTimeout");window.DARLA_CONFIG.onFailure = _onDarlaError("failure");window.DARLA_CONFIG.onIdle = function onDarlaIdle () {    try {        window._DarlaEvents && window._DarlaEvents.emit("onIdle");    } catch (e) {        console.error(e);        throw e;    }};})();
window.$sf = window.sf = {};
window.$sf.host = {onReady: function (autorender, deferrender, firstRenderPos, deferRenderDelay) {window._perfMark('DARLA_ONREADY');window._perfMeasure('DARLA_ONREADY');window.sfready = true;if (window._DarlaEvents && !autorender) {window._DarlaEvents.emit("darlaboot");} else if (autorender){window._perfMark('DARLA_RSTART');if (typeof DARLA !== "undefined" && DARLA) {if (deferrender && firstRenderPos) {var firstBatchPos = [];var prefetchedPos = DARLA.prefetched();if (prefetchedPos.length <= 0) {return;}var firstRender = firstRenderPos.split(',');if (firstRender && firstRender.length > 0) {for (var i = 0; i < firstRender.length; i++) {var position = firstRender[i];var index = prefetchedPos.indexOf(position);if (index >= 0) {firstBatchPos = firstBatchPos.concat(prefetchedPos.splice(index, 1));}};}if (firstBatchPos.length > 0) {var renderWithRetry = function(pos) {if (DARLA.inProgress()) {var waittime = 600, maxwait = 100, deferRetry = 0, interval;interval = setInterval(function() {deferRetry ++;if (!DARLA.inProgress()){clearInterval(interval);DARLA.render(pos);}if (deferRetry > maxwait){clearInterval(interval);}}, waittime);} else {DARLA.render(pos);}};renderWithRetry(firstBatchPos);setTimeout(renderWithRetry, deferRenderDelay, prefetchedPos);} else {DARLA.render();}} else {DARLA.render();}}}}
};

<script>(function () {
    var appDiv = document.getElementById('app');
    if (sessionStorage.getItem('yahooSansFinanceFontLoaded')) {
        // don't wait for fonts to load
        appDiv.className += ' Ff($yahooSansFinanceFont)!';
        return;
    }

    if ('fonts' in document && typeof Promise !== 'undefined' && appDiv) {
        Promise.all([
            document.fonts.load('1em Yahoo Sans Finance'),
            document.fonts.load('500 1em Yahoo Sans Finance'),
            document.fonts.load('600 1em Yahoo Sans Finance'),
            document.fonts.load('700 1em Yahoo Sans Finance')
        ]).then(function () {
            appDiv.className += ' Ff($yahooSansFinanceFont)!';

            // cache for repeated session views
            sessionStorage.setItem('yahooSansFinanceFontLoaded', true);
        });
    }
})();
</script>
<script>window.webpackPublicPath='https://s.yimg.com/uc/finance/dd-site/js/';</script></body></html>
